title: Oregon running back Cyrus Habibi-Likio tackles fan who ran onto the field
text:
CLOSE SportsPulse: USA TODAY Sports' Paul Myerberg provides his opinion of the top three programs in the history of college football. USA TODAY

It's been quite the Saturday night for Oregon running back Cyrus Habibi-Likio.

He scored a go-ahead touchdown to give the No. 13 Ducks a 10-7 lead in the third quarter against California. Before he did that, however, he tackled a fan who ran on the field at Autzen Stadium who was trying to escape security.

Habibi-Likio exited an Oregon huddle as the Ducks had gathered during the delay, ran nearly 20 yards and tackled the fan from behind. A referee and a few other Oregon players and coaches followed Habibi-Likio, but he got the fan on the ground and security took over from there.

Idiot running on the field tackled by Cyrus Hanibi-Likio pic.twitter.com/7MDY2oAacc — Kevin Wade (@KwadeSays) October 6, 2019

He got big cheers from the Oregon crowd for his efforts...

And the tackle of the game goes to Cyrus Habibi-Likio at @oregonfootball@uoregon.



I mean, when a rando interrupts the game by running around the field & you're trying to play, you gotta do what you gotta do. #goducks 🏈



alt vid: Oregon #33 tackles person evading authorities pic.twitter.com/G8dP4W97zw — Lisa Catto (@lisacatto) October 6, 2019

... And got even bigger cheers when he punched in a TD a short time later.

OREGON TAKES THE LEAD!!! Cyrus Habibi-Likio 1 yard go-ahead TD! pic.twitter.com/4vWIosFpXm — #BusinessAintBoomin (@ftbeard_17) October 6, 2019

A true two-way player, when you think about it.
description: A fan ran on the field at Autzen Stadium when Oregon played Washington. Ducks running back Cyrus Habibi-Likio tackled him
